title: Or code snippets
body:
Setup

bower install
cd vendor/bootswatch
ln -s bower_components/bootstrap/dist/fonts fonts
cd ../..

Deployment

grunt dist
cd dist
cp -r ../vendor/font-awesome/fonts /assets/fonts
ln -s assets/fonts fonts
git init
mv index.html home.html
touch index.php
echo '<?php include_once('home.html'); ?>' > index.php
git add .
git commit -m 'Site updated'
git remote add heroku git@heroku.com:embernote.git
git push heroku master --force
cd ..

title: You could store recipes
body:
Makes 4 dozen

Ingredients

  1. 1 cup butter, softened
  2. 1 1/2 cups white sugar
  3. 2 eggs
  4. 2 teaspoons vanilla extract
  5. 2 cups all-purpose flour
  6. 2/3 cup cocoa powder
  7. 3/4 teaspoon baking soda
  8. 1/4 teaspoon salt
  9. 2 cups semisweet chocolate chips
  10. 1/2 cup chopped walnuts (optional)

Directions

  1. Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).
  2. In large bowl, beat butter, sugar, eggs, and vanilla until light and fluffy.
  3. Combine the flour, cocoa, baking soda, and salt;
  4. Stir into the butter mixture until well blended.
  5. Mix in the chocolate chips and walnuts.
  6. Drop by rounded teaspoonfuls onto ungreased cookie sheets.
  7. Bake for 8 to 10 minutes in the preheated oven, or just until set.
  8. Cool slightly on the cookie sheets before transferring to wire racks to cool completely.

title: Welcome to EmberNote
body:
EmberNote is a web application designed for note-taking (similar to Evernote). On the side menu we have prepared several examples to help you get started with EmberNote.

EmberNote was built using Ruby on Rails (backend) and EmberJS (frontend) in 2014 by Sambya AS . Feel free to play around with this demo! or browse the source from github (backend and frontend).

Features

  1. Nice looking single page application (thanks EmberJS)
  2. Nice WYSIWYG editor (thanks tinyMCE)
  3. Well tested backend (thanks RSpec)
  4. Well documented APIs (thanks Apiary)
  5. Demo site (thanks Heroku)
